articles.title: What are AI hallucinations? Why AIs sometimes make things up - The Pagosa Springs Sun
articles.author: Anna Choi
articles.summary: Anna Choi, Cornell University and Katelyn Mei, University of Washington, studied hallucinations in AI speech recognition systems. Hallucinations are pieces of information that sound convincing but are incorrect, made up or irrelevant. It's important to distinguish between AI hallucinations and intentionally creative AI outputs.
